intro: Psychotria fulva var. brevibracteata, commonly known as the short-bract Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant features small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. This variant is distinguished by its shorter bracts compared to the typical form of Psychotria fulva.
